content: herringbone weave headband this beautiful stitch makes the perfect headband it is dense and thick providing extra warmth for those cold days it is extra wide so it covers your ears nicely although you can make it narrower if you wish the stitch looks complicated but it is actually very easy and only consists of a two- row repeat video instructions on knitting this stitch can be found here https //youtu be/vgybz86upfi © jackie henderson yarn worsted weight lion brand basic stitch color silver heather yardage approx 100 yards needle us size 5 finish size 20 x 4 5 abbreviations k = knit p = purl yo = yarn over wyib = with yarn in back wyif = with yarn in front sl = slip_stitch st = stitch sts = stitches pattern cast on 28 stitches row 1 k3 k1 * yo wyib sl1 k2 pass slip_stitch over 2 k sts * repeat from * to * to 3 sts from end k3 row 2 k3 p1 * yo wyif sl1 p2 pass slip_stitch over 2 p sts * repeat from * to * to 3 sts from end k3 repeat row 1 and 2 until piece measures 19 ¾ 20 in length bind off all stitches © jackie henderson with right sides together sew cast off and bind off edges together note for a narrower headband cast on 22 stitches and follow instructions as above note the 3 knit stitches at the beginning and end of each row are for the garter stitch border but that border is optional to knit this without the border cast on 6 stitches fewer than instructed and eliminate the k3 at the beginning and end of each row © jackie henderson
